The new bacon wrapped jalapenos are rather tasty and the sesame jack chicken strips are always good. However, the quality of the rest of the food is rather standard and mass production quality.
Food is amazing. But do yourself a favor don't order for carry out; you're food will always be cold.... Even if you tell them to make sure it's warm and freshly prepared.

Waitress was not very friend, more on the rude side..   would not come back again at this location...    foods were OK, nothing great.  My family was there last week for dinner.   There are many other restaurants  around the  area to enjoy dinner.  I just did not like bad service with waitress with attitude.

Riad is the best bartender I know he really knows his stuff and goes far and beyond for a customer and he always knows how to make my drink just right. I will always come to this fridays even if its just for drinks, it is the best in virginia!!

Would have given 4 stars but the manager was to lazy to do her job and correct our bill and charged us to much! The menu we ordered off had specials 2/$10 meal options and we ordered 2 things off there but when we got the bill we told the waiter and he said he'd correct it ! Then came back and said the manager would only slightly correct it because the special that was in our menu was expired and was supposed to be removed!  Pure BS and the manager should know better and do her job! I won't be coming back here !

this server SUCKS FUCKING DICK. The place is dead as fuck and it's been over an hour for fucking drinks. Erica you need to be fired. If I could give negative stars I fucking would. I'm a server and this is the worst shit I've ever seen. The manager needs to have a sit down with this chick because come on... An hour for two drinks?! Is this a fucking joke?! I got on my knees on the booth seat just to get her attention. Come on bitch!

I only come here just because I live very close. Customer Service- the servers are really nice.  Food- My bf always gets the Jack daniel's ribs,and I've tried it..its really good! Its really tender and juicy.the sauce they use really compliments the ribs. I've tried most of thestuff on the menu,and what really took my taste-buds away was the Cajun pasta :D  Place- I dont think its a family-friend-restaurant. The bar is right there once you enter the restaurant. And the music they place is not really suitable for kids. The place is too dark for me,they need more lights lol Im still coming back to this place because its by my house, their ribs and cajun pasta.

This used to be one of my favorite locations to eat at. Now I'll never be coming back here again.  The whole "new menu" thing is basically a scam. All it did was take a lot of items off of the 2 for $10 deals and make other items more expensive. And the 2 for $10 is 2 for $12 now.  I got an appetizer that I've been getting for a while...and it tasted horrible. The cheese in my spicy queso looked like ranch dressing with too many herbs in it (before it was literally just white cheese). The manager came over to address my concerns with it. Her first question to me seemed nice, but as soon as I told her my concern, she became snappy and aggressive.  To top it all off, she told all her employees that they only give military discount if you're in your uniform.  Get your stuff together, Friday's. You just lost a long-time customer.

Every single time I come here the wait is well over 30mins. The place is understaffed so you'll see a bunch of empty chairs, but not enough servers to cover them, thus preventing patrons from being seated quicker. On two different occasions, our waiters vented to our party about the management (I guess to prevent a shortage in their tips).  But who can blame them when your food takes forever to come out!  Also it seems as if they hire a lot of youngsters, which is fine, but train them on proper customer service. I would rather hit up the Chili's in Springfield than to experience this lackluster service again!

I had heard they had a pretty good healthier menu now, so with my husband and I both sticking to our New Year resolutions I checked out the nutritional info online to help me with ordering. Bingo!  This might not be bad.  We arrived on a Friday night going on 7 and were told a 15-20 minute wait, not awful, but less than ten minutes later we were shown to our booth. Nice! Booth was comfortable. Lately most booths I've been in have miles of space between bench and table and I end up perched uncomfortably on the edge of my seat to reach my food, this booth was nicely spaced. Waitress arrived promptly, took our drinks order and as we told her we were ready to order, our meal order as well. Husband ordered off the Right Portion Right Price menu so his meal was under 750 cal. Dragonfire Chicken with Jasmine Rice Pilaf and Broccoli. He said it was quite nice with a good balance of spicy (Kung Pao sauce) and sweet (fruit pieces). The broccoli was nicely cooked, bright green and still crisp like he prefers. I ordered flat iron steak (300 cal) with the langostino lobster topping (270 cal), mashed potatoes (my splurge at 210 cal) and mozzarella and tomato salad (90). The mozzarella and tomato salad is probably better in the summer but everything else was delicious and nicely portioned.  If you are watching what you eat a look at their nutrition info online first, or on your smartphone if you're already there, is a good idea as most of the menu is over the top high in calories, even items you may think of as good choices. But armed with some info it's not hard to eat well here. DJ came on while we were there, a bit loud for us, but we aren't the demographic they're aiming for (Get off my lawn!) So we'll avoid Friday nights when we come back.

Excellent service, my waiter Rob kept the drinks coming, had tips on how the burger could even be better (add the bacon), and the bar tender went out of his way to help a female customer sitting next to me at the bar.

This service was terrible we ordered two lunch meals, a burger and a blt half sandwich, It has taken 30 minutes so far and we dont have our food yet (a burger takes what, 7 mins to make?) and the entire restaurant had maybe 5 other people in it at this time. So were at 30 mins now right, the waitress came by and told us that the burger was made with onions, (asked for no onions) so that means the burger hasn't even been started yet! That is the only time we have seen her the whole time. Not Good!!!!!!

We just waited over 15 minutes at our table and nobody even came over to greet us or tell us they would be right with us- literally nothing. We decided to leave and ended up having to put our hungry toddler back in the car and drive to another restaurant. According to other reviews I guess this isn't surprising information. We are former servers and more than understanding about certain things, but this was unacceptable. We will be sure to read the reviews ahead of time from now on, and will definitely steer clear of this place. What a joke. For the prices on their menu, the least they can do is hire servers that know how to pay attention to their section.

My co-worker's and I met up here on a Friday night as a going away party for our manager. I had to work a closing shift so was not able to meet with them til a little later.... when I arrived everyone seemed satisfied. Then the checks were brought out. I felt terrible thinking I was super late.. nope. The lady just brought out everyone's checks without asking if they were done. All I wanted was a drink so I rushed to order one so I wouldn't hold them behind if they wanted to leave......... only problem is that our waitress either a) directly ignored me or b) would disappear for a long time. I finally had to track down ANOTHER waitress so I could get a drink. Really frustrating. Also another waitress in the area next to ours apparently knew one of my co-worker's.. and proceeded to constantly talk to us instead of waiting on tables. It got a little annoying but we all tolerated it... until she started being inappropriate and making shrewd comments. One of my co-workers is a single mom and brought her 12 year old daughter with her............. So yeah, NOT okay. Have some manners.  I might try out their happy hour but if my experience with that is similar to my last, I will not be returning.

I love TGIF and I thank them for the free meals for military veterans on Veteran's Day.  It is a very generous gesture and is much appreciated. However  on November 11, 2014 I showed up at this location at 1:56 p.m. and was told that I was too late for the free meal.  To the hostess that delivered me this news, I wish you the best of luck when the Russians overrun your position.  I will not respond to your cries for help for I will be at Applebees defending Riblets, mini-cheeseburgers, and freedom fries.

Best happy hour deal in Springfield, but you may have to fight off wards of people for a seat at the bar. I haven't been in awhile but it seems that the service has gone down hill since their regular bartenders high tailed it to other local watering holes. The food is nothing memorable and I've heard horrible stories about waiters messing with client's food.  Meh. Definately not a destination, more like a last resort.
Food wasn't bad..wasn't good either.   Worst was the server. If you need a visual aid, view the Lonely Island video "The Creep".

Seriously... Your stores motto is "Thank God it's Friday." But in reality I hate going to Fridays on Friday. Fridays has 0, ZERO, deals on Friday and all of the drinks and food and appetizers are full price... COOL THANK GOD ITS FRIDAY!!!! So I made the rule that I will only go on Wednesdays and Thursdays if I do go because they do have some good deals and cheap drinks those days. But way to make Fridays at Fridays something to not look forward to.

The waiter was so rude and it turned me off from coming back here. Came in for appetizers, said we couldn't share but all I wanted was a few bites since I wasn't hungry. So we had to order two appetizers just for me to try them. Then he says we can't get them to go even thought they're going to throw them out anyway. Horrible service and nasty staff. Don't wanna go back. Sorry you lost a customer.

The atmosphere is nice,  and the food was good however the service left something to be desired.  The waiter seemed inexperienced and very pushy when taking our order.  He did list any of the specials for the day, and seemed very rushed which was crazy being at the time he only had 1 other table. The host kicked in to assist in running the food and seemed like he would have  been a better fit as the waiter being he was attentive and quick with bringing back the items we requested for our meal.  I the only reason I am rating as 2 stars is because the chefs did their job and made great food.  We would not recommend this place to others.

Worst service ever.  I had come here with my girlfriend to have dinner. Before we even sit down the table is all wet and even after the hostess wiped it down it was really wet! After that the server asks us what we wanted to order. We placed them in and everything. However the sever would only come back after every 30 mins. He forgot he was serving us! Always said sorry when he came back to us. At the end we ordered the brownie with ice cream on top. However... The ice was all melted and it was basically brownie and ice cream soup. Worst 2 hours spent at a restaurant for me.

I have been here a total of 2 times in the last month. The food is decent for the price. The bar is horrible. Only 1 bartender for the entire restaurant. I see a lot of customers waiting around   Impatiently with their empty glasses. I am not sure how this place makes money? But will not be coming back. This place needs new management asap!
Half rack baby back ribs for 10 bucks were way to small. Service was good and food was ok but for 10 bucks I could at least have gotten more than 15 fries. The ribs should be twice as big

No hostess. Slow service. Lazy, slow, unprofessional manager pretending to help a bartender.  Incorrect order placed. Dirty bar. Dirty restaurant. I've seen enough NOT to go back again...health inspector would have a field day in this place. Just disgusting all around.
The burgers here taste like heaven. Although there is a downside. The lemonade at this location is horrible and gave me stomach problems. Next time I will get iced tea

This is definitely one of the national chains I refer to often in my reviews that frequently causes me to cringe.  Although not the avid fan of the box-sets, I do give them opportunities to redeem themselves and often relegate error and quality to the 'human factors'.  Thus, my wife and I recently decided to give them a chance at culinary redemption.  Surprise, surprise, surprise... they redecorated this place (until not to recently, in bad need of an update) - apparently about six months prior to our visit... nice job, although some of the cheap work and corner cutting is pretty obvious with over-sprayed ceiling vents and booth divider panels with recent paint already peeling!  Otherwise, the place is much brighter, roomier and the acoustics and amenities vastly improved.  We also marveled at their new and improved menu with more variety, and apparently quality offerings!  Our server was also very good, Chyna is warm and charming in her presentation, attention to detail and service excelled - although we don't blame her for pushing the promotions management has driven her to push.  Since we'd already had our heart set on sandwiches, we decided to try their sandwich and burger selections.  I had the extremely flavorful, messy and juicy Philly Stacked Burger: with braised shredded beef, mozzarella, Asiago & parmesan cheeses, roasted cremini mushrooms, spicy giarinera & green onions, with Swiss cheese, lettuce, tomato, (w/o horseradish spread), onion bacon jam and peppered bacon (just slightly over-peppered), these ingredients worked really well together, the only other burger better locally (as far as I'm concerned) is Austin Grill's 'Hangover Burger';  plus started out with the Broccoli Cheese Soup: with American and Cheddar Cheeses, pretty good except if I hadn't added salt and pepper, it wouldn't have been; my wife had the tasty and well prepared California Club Sandwich: with turkey breast, apple wood-smoked bacon, ham and Monterey Jack cheeses on toasted freshly baked baguette and romaine lettuce, tomatoes, (although they were a little stingy on the) avocado and mayo along with sweet potato fries.  We washed our meal down with Ice Tea and a Hot Earl Gray Tea.  I must say kudos to corporate for the improvement which makes me say something I usually don't say about chains - we'll be back.  Thank God it's a new Fridays!

The bar mgr obviously has had a bad day today. Or maybe she has had a continuance of of her workers not responding to her demands. So today she decides to show it to everyone during happy hour. She called the bar tenders idiots while she spoke to them like they are incompetent and her kids. She was upset over mint and labels! I then spoke to the mgr of the entire of restaurant and he agreed with my disappointment of her being a leader and paying customers to see her behavior. However, he continues to defend her and tells me I do not know the whole story. One thing I do not want to know the story NOR I want to witness someone belittling anyone.  Currently she is talking about how happy she is to see one of her workers to walk out and it being less paperwork. Overall the GM needs to have a talk with the entire staff on customer service and talking to people.

Generally,  I enjoy the food here. Before I begin,  let's admit that I like both McDonald's and mortons (Ruth cris too) as meat places at the quick cheap end or long expensive night end. What I don't enjoy is being fooled , tricked or lied to folks. Now,  we all have kitchens do we not ? Is cutting a steak into cubes for a skewar difficult ? No it is not, nor is putting veggies on said skewar. Sooooo, if you have steak and a skewar how do you run out of steak on a skewar ? Well, seems at 6pm .... this Fridays is fresh out. I offered to pay extra and to wait for the skewar, but no joy . This lack of imagination or can do attitude is why I do not like the service here. I can plainly see the bar drinks are where the money and attention is and not my to go order. Mortons and Ruth will make anything for u if they have the ingredients and you have time. Seems Fridays just does not give a darn and takes the easy way out while reaching for the low hanging booze fruit customer in their business model. So,  next time massive cut some steak and put it on a skewar if u would like my business please ? Why am I saying please,  you should ask me  please for my business on second thought.  So,  my dollars go down the street to other steal places.

The worst, don't know where to start, the rude waitress or the disgusting cocktails or the cold food? Well it's a combination of all of the above. I have been to many TGIs but never seen such low.  We tried this place 4 times as we live very near but never going there again!

I am literally sitting in the parking lot writing this review. The hostess was nice and accommodating. I wanted a booth and was willing to wait, but when we were seated, we were seated to a wet table. Gross! Strike one. Then the waiter, who was nice enough came and took our order, he wasn't super personable but he was efficient, which was cool, I'm not looking for a bestie. I ordered a ribeye medium rare. It came out like a hockey puck. Strike two. Sent it back, and 15 minutes later, another puck was delivered. So I had sides, but no steak. I also had to go in search of my barbecue sauce for my son after asking for it twice. Really? Strike three.  I didn't pay for the steak, but still....I really wanted a steak. Uggh. A lot was going on here today. Not sure if it was Mother's Day stress or what, but it wasn't crowded. If it wasn't for the very nice Apothic Red, my dinner would've sucked. I'm disappointed, I usually have a much better experience. Get it together guys, or I'll be moving on!

Dirty, HORRIBLE service, and shady staff!! Read your receipt carefully! The tables were sticky and look like they have never been cleaned. The walls have built up grim and food splatter.   The customer service is horrible.  My father asked that his food be taken back because it was not cooked all the way.  He didnt say anything just took it back. When he brought it back, he still didnt say anything. Not a word!  When he brought the check, it was $160! We were a group of 7 people and the majority of us got the 2 for $10 and we only had soft drinks.  The receipt that he gave us was not itemized, which was unusual. The items read: food, tax, and tip (he added 18% eventhough we did not have 8 people).   We told him that we think something was wrong with our receipt. He explained to us that because we used a coupon for a free app, they could not give us the 2 for $10.  He was very rude and said that there was nothing that he could do about it.  When we asked to see the manager, he came back with a receipt that had the correct amount on it with no tip, this time.  We asked to see the manager again and he asked "Why? its correct." We said again we wanted to see a manager and he said "Oh my god" and walked away.   When the manager came, he was just as rude as the waitor. He told us to "stop talking so that he could explain."  Really?!? He then told us the exact same that thing the waitor said and was talking to us as if were idiots.  He just kept defending the waitor, instead of realizing what the problem was. He clearly did not know how to be a manager! If the waitor would have told us in the begining that we could not use a coupon with the 2 for $10 deal, there would have not been a problem. Their staff needs some serious customer service training!

$40 for two tall beers, half rack of baby back ribs, deep fried green bean appetizer, roasted chicken salad and Oreo dessert. It has been over 20 years since I last visited a T.G.I. Friday's: so sub-optimal was the last visit. My wife and I stopped for a late dinner after taking a night-time walk on the National Mall in DC visiting several monuments.  After the three hour walking we were hungry and thirsty.  Where to eat at 11:30 pm? We yelp'd up T.G.I. Friday's near the Franconia-Springfield metro stop and the ratings were okay and they were open, so gave them a try. The beers were delivered FAST.  I mean F A S T!  Which was a good thing. The appetizer was green beans dredged in a panko-like batter and deep fried and served with a horseradish infused dipping sauce.  It was much better than I expected.  I'd order it again. My baby back ribs were meaty and fall-off-the bone tender and served with extra sauce, a ginger slaw and french fries.  Very good. My wife's chicken salad included a generous helping of roasted chicken, big hunks of avocado all served over a very generous helping of greens.  She liked it a lot. The Oreo dessert was something that looked like it was prepared at some giant factory somewhere and shipped out pre-frozen.  Two oversized cookies filled with soft serve ice cream.  Boring... On the down side the place is very, very noisy.  If you sit in the bar you'll leave with a headache.  We took a table away from the bar where it was still noisy but we could at least talk to one another. Overall:  I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food and rapidity of service.  While I am not likely to add this place to my "must visit" list: I am now less likely to dismiss the brand when I am searching for someplace to eat late at night. Recommended.

I would NOT recommend going there.  The server we had was very rude and told me he did not like people sitting in his section if they weren't going to drink since it is a cocktail section.  We tell the manager about this and doesn't even apologize for the situation.  I will be posting this on all social sites and calling the corporate office for this situation has been very upsetting to me.

One of the worst restaurant experiences I've had in a while. My husband and I came in on a Wednesday night so many tables were open and just left uncleaned. We had to wait for 20 minutes still for a table. The server was clearly very busy and not able to handle his tables. He took forever to bring us our drinks, when our food finally came by someone other than our server my husbands meal was not at all what he ordered. His burger was 90% iceberg lettuce. We had waited so long for our food at that point we just ate and by the time the server actually came by to check on us we just let him know what happened with his meal. He offered to comp his meal which was nice of him, we didn't ask for that or expect it but he did. When he came back he didn't say a word just handed us the bill and when my husband gave him his card for payment and he came back with the slip to sign again he said nothing. No have a good night, sorry for the delay or the mistake nothing. He acted so rudely toward us as though we had thrown a fit at him or something. We didn't ask for him to take the food off the bill but he obviously got reamed out by his manager for it.  Don't take that out on your customers though. we were so disappointed with not only the food but the service. We won't be back.

I got a buy one get one free coupon for Friday's and decided to give this location a shot. I had been on self-implemented Friday's hiatus since the late 90's because sooooo many times they were really never up to par in terms of their service.  But this Fridays was awesome! It's big and pretty nice (for a Friday's!). Our server was good and the food was delicious. They had something I've never seen before too - handheld order computers and CC swipers! AWESOME!!!  If you are in the mood for a Fridays I'd recommend this one.
Is it me or TGI Fridays food and service is declining. I use to look forward to TGI, but after last night, I have second thoughts. Sorry tfi, but you deserve only 3 stars!

Very obvious from the start this location cannot handle a dinner time crowd.  Had to wait 15-20 mins for a table with tables clearly available and plenty of staff "working".  After finally getting a table, we had to ask for it to be wiped clean.  After ordering drinks and an appetizer, it took a while to get a beer as the waiter admitted "the bartender had to catch up".  The appetizer never came and 40 mins later our meal arrived and was not correct.  Never going back.
Sit at the bar and ask for JC. He will take good care of you; Especially if it's your birthday.. or your girl friend's 21st birthday.
Our waitress Stephanie is great, she's super friendly and is a great conversationist. We would totally come back to this place just because of her.
Okay, don't go here.  Ever. They just forced me to roll over one star to post this.

This Friday's is actually in Springfield, VA.   Now, I love Friday's, BUT- they are NOT all the same. This was the happiest, perkiest, Friday's I've ever been in.  I think all the staff must have been sniffing catnip.  They were all so bubbly, nice, and fast. Food and drinks were excellent, service was superb, decor was nice, heck, even the other diners in the restaurant were giddy and lively.  It was like we were filming for a commercial- happy people, happy staff, good food, all having a BLAST at Friday's.

I was looking around for someplace in the Springfield area to have dinner, as I often do on Wednesday evenings.  It had been probably 5-6 years since I had been here, but all the other candidate restaurants were given awful ratings, so I thought I would try TGIF again.  Like Applebee's and similar restaurants, they are catering now a bit more to those looking for something a bit healthier.  I checked out the nutritional information first, which looked promising (except too much salt!), and I was looking for a good steak in particular.  In general, the food was very good, although I had to cut off quite a bit of fat on the Rib Eye.  The price was reasonable, and the service was also very good.  I wasn't too fond of the music, as others have noted, but I go to restaurants to eat, not to dance or wax nostalgic.  I would go back there again.

The food here is pretty good. I never had anything here I didn't like but I know a few people I ate here with have where some things were overcooked or not very hot, etc but i never had that issue. My food has always been cooked well, the drinks are really good here as they make the best cocktails in town. The staff here is really great too. Everyone seems very friendly and helpful.
Its a very good Fridays!! We go to this location about once a week. we like the staff, always nice waiters, food comes fast & its always been good.

I dont understand the low reviews. I love this TGI Friday's! They have a consistent staff who, if you go there enough, you can get to know. They are all extremely friendly and I have never had bad service here. The food is great, I usually go for lunch or dinner. Of course, on Friday's it is packed so beware. If you go any other day of the week, there is barely anybody here and its a very nice atmosphere. They have free wifi too! Be sure to enroll in their rewards, you get free food!
The food is really cheap and tastes alright. We come here pretty regularly and everyone is pretty friendly. My only complaint is that the Red Bull Vodka's don't have enough Red Bull.

I was at this location two nights ago, and sat at the bar with a friend of mine.  We had a horrible experience.  Bartenders helped people around us, but completely ignored us unless we talked to them.  When someone's drink is empty, a bartender should ask if they want another, right? We ordered 3 appetizers - the Tuscan Flatbread, the Mozzarella Sticks, and the Potato Skins.  The first two were okay, but the potato skins were horrible.  The potatoes tasted dry and stale.  The cheese was gross and oily.  I know that it's not health food, but this was BAD! Drinks were ok when we got them, but like I said, that didn't happen often.  There were 3 bartenders, and the bar was not full.  We got attitude from 2 of the bartenders, and I'm not sure why.  Did they think we should have fallen over ourselves to impress them??  No. I worked at a TGI Friday's years ago, and I know how employees were trained.  They are clearly not trained properly or well.  The TGIF on King Street in Alexandria does not have ANY of these problems.  I will not be going back to the TGIF in Springfield EVER AGAIN.

Normally, I would not enter TGIF because my past experences with screaming kids all over the restraurants drove me nuts.  But this was a special situation, they had nice windows and I could see my two dogs in the car outside.  I had some sort of chicken salad-vey unremarkable and a blue slush drink.  I think I may be radioactive now because of that drink.  But we were first in line when it opened at 1PM and no nutty kids.  So if you have dogs and you don't care about food, this could be the place.
From my 8 year old daughter: food is better than Chili's - for whatever that is worth.  service was just eh.  good for families.
Staff is friendly. Food is good. Service could be beter especially in the kitchen. Food usually turns out being too salty or too cold.

My wife and I have been here several times.  The food is usually decent at best.  The service could use improvement.  We will not return after our last visit.   It took nearly 20 minutes to receive two waters and sodas.  Our appetizer went long and came out ice cold, the salad came even later.  The food also went long and was mediocre.  Our server would just fly by, drop everything off, and run away before we could speak with her.  We figured this kind of thing happens every now and then and just brushed it off. That was until we were over charged on the check.  She later returned with the proper check, but still somehow over charged our cards. Again she promised to fix it, but then over charged us again.  When I asked to speak to a manager the server responded "Why? She already knows about it.  It'll take a few days for the charges to come off", then she ran away again. Over the course of a week I spoke to the general manager and a supervisor over the phone.  Both couldn't be bothered and just kept saying you'll have to wait 2-3 days for the faulty charges to correct.  They did not.  I eventually had to email corporate, because I will not pay 3x for the price of 2 bad meals.  The charges were eventually fixed, but corporate did not even contact me.

A friend and I were pleasantly surprised to see that the facility had had a make over since our last visit.  We were seated but very uncomfortable, as the music was so loud that it was distorted.  I mentioned it to security and then later asked for the manager.  We explained that the music was loud and distorted and the manager moved us to a different table.  The manager went on to explain that "this is how Friday's is on friday" (loud).  I told the manager that I had been to Friday's all over the world and never seen or heard anything like this.  Further I explained that he was damaging the equipment because the amplifier is not designed to operate in distribution.  One last thing worth noting...  The music selection was strange as it seemed better suited for a Afro-American dance club than a Friday's in a Northern VA suburb.  Maybe it's just personal taste but, this music was for everyone right?  Is this part of the new changes?  If yes, Friday's will have to come off of my list of favorite neighborhood restaurants.

This was the worst service I've had at a restaurant in a long time. Although it was busy it should not have taken over 20 minuted for a simple chip and dip appetizer. It took even longer for our mediocre entrees. The waitress never once apologized for the slow service. She hardly checked back with us at all. We had to hunt her down for the check and then she gave us the check for a different table. I think we could have paid it (it was much lower than our bill) and left and she wouldn't have noticed. It took over two hours for dinner because service was so slow. There was a DJ on a Thursday night, which was a little strange, playing some great throwback jams but at 2am Saturday in the club levels. On the upside the interior seemed recently redone. And the $3 monitor was excellent but not good enough to make me ever want to return.

Is this the one near springfield mall? Well I came here couple of times, and the waiter/waitresses were nice. One time the waitress forgot one of my friend's order but she apologized so I guess it's ok. One time my family and I had a really nice waiter he kept coming back to make sure that everything was ok. I am very happy when I get good service, it makes my mood and experience even better with the good food. Their steaks and ribs are so yummy. I enjoy this TFI fridays more than Tysons because sometimes the Tysons location can get crowded and loud since it's located inside the mall. This location is more chill.

I like the staff. I usually never have any issues there. I am a regular at this location. Every once in a while there is an issue with the host not being in the front when you come in. So your just waiting for a while to be seated. But that rarely happens to me. Every blue moon. Other than that, food and service is always good.

I was underimpressed. It is a tgi Friday chain but there was an argument there with some customers and the host that I didn't even see the manager come out to assess or diffuse and the 2 kids pizzas we ordered were both black on top and they said that is just the way they make them. BS. Then the waiter must have thought we were finished cause he came and took our drinks and we thought he would fill them , but nope, he brought the check back.
Worst TGIFriday's I have ever eaten at.  Have given this on so many chances since opening.  It continues to get worse Terrible service and even worse food Worst place to eat in Waldorf

Not the experience I was looking for. Bartender Tommy was so unfriendly, didn't provide utensils w/ my appetizer, assumed I wanted a draft when I preferred a bottle beer. The female bartender just ignored me while i waited to order, menu in hand. This is a fail at customer service, find a new career. The food was ok, but over cooked and had very little of the toppings the menu boasted about.

I love this place because its close to the entrance to HOV towards 95 South so its the perfect place to stop at on the way home from work. I always have fun when I come here because the music's loud, the bartenders & waitresses are in great moods and everybodys there to have a good time. During Happy Hour, the margaritas are good and strong and CHEAP and the wings are cooked to perfection....

Service was not good at all. It took about 7 mins to get any condiments and even silverware to eat my food with my friend as I could not eat it right away. My server did not check up on  my table till maybe 20 mins after receiving food . And when he did come had a bad attitude as well while talking to my table.

DON'T meet anyone here for dinner and drinks and then go somewhere else together.  They TOW YOUR CAR in a matter of hours (even when their lot is empty).  I'll never go back and hopefully I can save my fellow Yelpers from the $125 fee I had to pay.  Meet somewhere else!  Hard Times Cafe in Springfield is where I'm going next time.  NEVER GOING BACK here!
We had excellent service from Mike K and the food was delicious.  We went on a weeknight and I was surprised at how popular this restaurant was, although we did not have to wait to be seated.
Staff is nice enough. Consistently mediocre. Get what you expect

I have never been to a Fridays before, but this was the only restaurant close to my hotel so I decided to try it. As soon as I walked in there was a security guard who made a really weird face when he saw me. I ignored it and looked for the hostesses. There were 2 hostesses both just leaning back against a wall. I walked over to them and they both just stared at me and didn't say anything. They didn't say hi, they didn't ask if I wanted to sit down, absolutely nothing. I finally realized they weren't interested in working so I just asked if I could sit at the bar. The bartender was absolutely great and if she was the only person I dealt with I would have given a better rating. The food was sub-par, nothing great. I complained to the manager about the hostess and he didn't really seem like he cared, he just pretty much said "oh well if you're sitting at the bar, then you don't need to be seated" That wasn't really the point, but ok? I left after I ate and definitely don't plan on returning. Bad service.

A good friend of mine is a bartender here so I feel somewhat traitorous saying this but.... God, this place sucks. The staff is friendly and it definitely has a neighborhood bar and restaurant feel to it... but I wait a minimum of 45 minutes - hour every time I go so I guess the kitchen staff is snorting lines in the back or something...
Been to many Fridays with bad experiences. This one seems to be better then the rest. Good food with good service.

Gave me the heeby geebies.  The bartenders looked like they escaped from prison.  Smoke, smoke, smoke, is the operative word in here.  We were only one's not smoking.  They had a cop on duty (always makes me wonder).  It was dark.  Reminded me of the Star Wars bar scene.  We finished up our dinner and left as quickly as possible.  This TGIF's fits the Springfield Mall motif quite well.

Utterly the worst situation I have been in. The most incompetent pair of bartenders I've seen in any restaurant. They don't even acknowledge ANYONE who sits down at the bar. If you get to actually order your food it is auctioned off as if it's a free raffle. And then everyone gets to breath all over it because whoever runs the food out they leave it in front of anyone. Other people joking around saying it's theirs, then finally one bartender will remember who ordered it and by time they get it it's probably cool. Not like anyone cares if you like your food or not because no one checks to see.  If you do need anything sauce, napkin, your food hopefully another guest will see you trying to get the bartenders attention and maybe just maybe they can get them for you. And just maybe you can get everything you need to FINALLY eat your meal. Oh no maybe not because someone else's meal is all over you silverware. Come the F on!!# Really!!##&€*/? I ask for plasticware just to enjoy my Mac and cheese, but great there is no cheese just oil and noodles oh a little bit of cheese that is dried on. Dont make excuses for that either. I have had that same Mac n cheese at the kings street location and it was good. Could you have at lease tried to make it eatable.  Seriously you all should be ashamed at your service. Corporate should just let everyone of you go and start some fresh hiring. Its so sad that that is how you treat anyone. If you would not want your own mother to get that kind of treatment then don't dish it. Take pride in what you do even if it is working at tgi Fridays. Zero stars.
Food is delicious here and staff is friendly, came on a Friday evening at 630, and were seated promptly. Highly recommended the flat iron w/ ribs w/ Jack Daniels sauce!!! Best sauce ever!
Not pleased at all. Nice waitress but the food was cold, nasty and unsatisfying. Very empty i see why. I'll try another fridays next time.
This is the only Fridays I like. Every time I go somewhere else, I get sick. I love the service and food here The steak and Mac and cheese are amazing!

The staff here were super nice. I decided to get TGI Fridays as a throw back, I liked it in college (like ~15 years ago). Since college I have had many foods. I think I learned a lot about food quality since then. Let's just say this is a trip down memory lane I will not take again. From now on if I want junk food I will indulge with just some straight up fast food- Wendy's or something. It is no worse for you and I think it tastes better.

Worse customer service!  The gave us a 1/2 bowl of soup!  Manager came over and said that their soup are all portioned, and if we wanted to have a full bowl of soup, we will need to pay for the price of 2 bowls! We declined as who wanted to pay double for a full bowl of soup?

This is one of my favorite Fridays location. I've had nothing but good experiences here. Sometimes the wait can be a little long but that is understandable because I do visit this location only on weekends when I am in the area. I've visited Fridays in Alexandria and let's just say that I would drive the distance to this location any day whenever I am craving for Fridays!

I wish I could give it zero stars. The food was extremely cold, drinks were never refilled even upon asking, had to go get our own silver wear...after asking our server for it which he never got, and the waiter had a terrible attitude about all of it. He never apologized or recognized what had happened. All and all if you go, you don't want Jarrell as your server and you can expect your food to be cold!!

Food was awesome!!!! Service was horrible. Waited for drinks.. Nicole took a super long time bringing us our food. Was a little too friendly with the group of boys sitting across from our family table. Cut me off while I was talking... Do not recommend this location. Especially not Nicole.  Just checked my statement today and the total was more than I had spent at this location.. Called in regards to my bill being higher than what I spent there and turns out the waiter had changed my tip.  General manager Khari called me today and tried to bribe his way through me accepting his apology

Understaffed.  Endless appetizers just a gimmick.   Said it would be 25 mins to get one order and ordering two is frowned upon as it backs up the kitchen.  Wish we would learn our lesson and stop coming here. After I wrote this, our amended order (burgers) came out quickly.  We did not order the endless appetizers because of the forewarning.  I really hate that.  They could easily solve that problem by bringing everyone two plates immediately.  No back up and slow down the running around just because the first single order is wolfed down by hungry people.  They should just stop the propmotion if they are going to hinder its use.   The waiter was very friendly and seemed to be concerned that we get our food as quickly as possible.   Now that I'm thinking about it, the seating took a long time.  There were several empty tables that remained empty from the time I got in line on a fifteen minute waiting list until we left an hour later.  Odd.

This location is my prime location for late night dining...LOYALTY MEMBER. my husband and I have been coming here for years. Progressively getting worse and worse. Currently dining here at the moment and the encounter with our server is absolutely horrible. What I thought was gonna be GOOD turned out to be a miserable.  Carlos seems like a nice guy, but he's only nice when saying hi and bye. Then just left us. And walked away when I was speaking to him...didnt even care to ask us if we were ready. Just completely forgot about us. So after getting drinks and one app. We decided to call it quits and paid and left. I'm a server too as a part time job, one thing I can say is at least fake it even if you aren't happy. Seriously turned me off and luckily my husband stops me from being the biggest b^#&h of all time. Anyways...i wish they would hire better servers that don't have freaking attitudes. Ugh completely ruined my nights.

This would probably be one of the worst TGI Fridays locations I've been to. The host was nice. Sat us promptly. No wait time at all. Then we proceeded to wait about 20 mins without being acknowledged by a waiter. No water. Nothing. We actually had to get up and leave without even putting in an order. As a member of the Fridays rewards program, I'm fully aware of the great service Fridays is capable of. This was completely inexcusable. The additional star is for the host, or this would be a one star rating.
The food is good. I have had the steaks and burgers which are good. The service is always friendly, but can be slow. The atmosphere is alright. I like this place for a relatively quick dinner.

Visiting from out of town and decided to visit this location. Boy do we regret it. Ordered endless apps only to find out that they didn't have the kitchen help to fulfill the orders as they come in as we waited on average 20-30 minutes in between orders. Waitress was unapologetic and very rude(heavy set black chick that's bald).Piss poor service. Super long wait. Don't waste your time.

Please dry up the seats if you use wet towel to clean it. It was disgusting to see your customers  jump away from the chair when touching the wet chair. I had to get a napkin from the bar and dry up my own seat. Really!? TGIF!
Ordered Prime Rib and they delivered New York Strip.  Rib Eye corrected and it was tough.  Fries were mediocre as was the service.  Not picky but this was over the top.  Not for me again.

Please, grab your reading glasses and something strong to drink for I have a story to tell you.  Setting the mood: The sky was dark and filled with stars, and it was Christmas Eve. We were already out and about trying to finish up some last minute shopping.  We called ahead to TGIF to make sure that the place is still open. They didn't close until 8:00pm, so we decided to head there and eat dinner. Of course we are filled with holiday cheer and joy because its Christmas time. So, we walk in and one of the hosts begins to take us to our seats. We ask to be seated in a booth section and she says okay thats not a problem, BUT! I just so happened to have turned around to see the other folks that were also having dinner. The other host was giving us an evil look, the kind of look where someone cuts their eyes to the conner of their eye sockets wanting to say something. We brushed it off though. We get to our booth and long story short, throughout the whole meal I am seeing this woman give my girl looks all night long. My girl is the one who asked for our seats to be changed, so I figured it had something to do with that. Not 100% sure, but thats just what I gathered from what was going on. Never said anything to her though, because it was Christmas time and we were in a good mood just being with each other. My reason for sharing this with you, Ive read a few reviews where people have encountered problems as well at this very same location. Other than that, its time for the food review. The food wasn't bad, not a big TGIF fan, the food is okay at best. The wings I had last night were pretty good, I believe they were flavored with Memphis BBQ. I must say, I actually enjoyed that. Id order it again whenever we go back, it taste better than the Jack Daniels wings to me. Their Strawberry Lemonade was pretty good too. Im very big on lemonade, so I always order lemonade wherever I go. Don't have much to say about this place, its your typical "lets go somewhere and chill" type spot if you're hungry.
We come here frequently. Amy was the best server we've had by far! She came by frequently and made sure our drinks were never dry.
Worker named Jonathan realy made my experience, gave that man a well deserved tip! Give him one is you see him!!
Food was pretty good but service is SLOW.  Restaurant only about 1/3 full, lots of servers but took FOREVER to get our bill. Server only came once.

We headed to TGI Fridays yesterday for a late dinner because well, thank God it was Friday! The parking lot was packed but we were still able to be seated right away. We sat down at about 8:30pm. I noticed that it was extremely loud. They were pretty busy, because it took our server about 10 minutes to come by, say hello, and get our drink orders.  I do want to say that she wasn't bad. She was extremely nice, just not the most attentive. We would go long stretches without seeing her, while we waited for a century for our drinks and food to arrive. A big pet peeve of mine is getting my drink order at the same time as my food. I was worried this was going to happen, but luckily (sort of?) the food took even longer than expected so I could enjoy my drink and even order a second one lol. No judgements! This was all before our food came out.   A half hour later, we got our drinks. And THEN our food came at 9:20pm, with my second drink. We were there for FOREVER! I had the Regal Apple Sangria and the Tito's Mule, while Jeff had the Seasonal Sam Adam's - Cold Snap. The Apple Sangria didn't wow me, but the Mule did! The lime and ginger beer cut the vodka perfectly! Besides the obnoxious wait time, the food was excellent. I ordered the Mac and Cheese Burger with a side of Chrispy Brussel Sprouts and Jeff just ordered from the appetizer menu, getting onion rings and sliders with a side of fries. My burger was cooked perfectly and the combination of the mac and cheese and bacon were heavenly. I liked how they prepared the mac and cheese to be in a sort of crust, to keep it all together while still being ooey and gooey.  The brussel sprouts were seasoned and dressed really well too. Balsamic goes so well with these!  So overall, I had a pretty good evening, but I think next time I'll just order out and avoid having to eat here.

I used to occasionally hit up TGIF for their endless apps. I liked it because they were open later than most other establishments. Their food was always lack luster, but it was cheap, so I can't argue with that. You get what you pay for.  Recently, they rose their price from $10 to $15. That's a 50% increase, for those keeping score at home. They actually decreased the number of options on the app menu. The $15 price puts them on par with other buffets with WAY better options.  I will not be returning to TGIF again. Not here or any other location. Also, why don't they clean their bathrooms with that extra $5 I gave them?

It was a busy Saturday night and we received very fast service! Our waiter Stephen was amazing! He was so funny, so kind, and very helpful when we had questions with the menu. The drinks and food we ordered were accurate. Something we honestly didn't think would have happened considering how busy it was. Everything tasted terrific!

I cannot speak for the in restaurant experience because I only ordered the food for pick up. Everything we ordered came out great and there wasn't a long line to pick up. We ordered the Bourbon Barrel Chicken with a side of ribs as well as the Jack Daniels Chicken. The food was good and would probably stop by again the next time we are in the area.

Wow, great service! I wanted the drink specials with the kids so they found a table for us. I highly recommend the drink specials! Kids both got for for under 6.00 each and left full. There were many options of food and everything we got was very tasty. Our server name was Diamond and she was so on point and helpful and my kids loved her! I really liked her and the food!

I'm increasing my rating to A-OK.  I have been a couple times mostly because of location and space.  Most recently hubby and I met a co-worker visiting from out of the area who was staying nearby.  Hubby and I started at the bar area while waiting for the co-worker and had a good experience.  Moving to a table was easy; no guilt or annoyed looks, just paid the drink bill and easily moved.  The meals were all fine, no one didn't like their selection.  I had ribs, hubby had salmon, and co-worker had steak.  I was able to sub sweet potato fries easily.  Our new waiter was friendly and upbeat.  While I am not going to make a deliberate trip to TGI Fridays, when I am in the area and in the mood it will now be on my radar.

Well people it's official. I just had my last meal EVER at the Springfield TGI Friday's. This restaurant has the most consistently bad customer service of any restaurant I have ever been to. Are you surprised I gave it two stars? Yes I'm surprised as well. But, the food was good and the Manager tried to save the day by being nice and offering a free desert coupon. But it's a little to late. What I should say is what food we got was good. BECAUSE WE DIDN'T GET EVERYTHING WE ORDERED. Look at the picture of our receipt. You will see the appetizer $12.99 taken off our bill. That's because we never got it. But it didn't end with them losing just $12.99. When we go to TGI Friday's we always order an appetizer and have two drinks and then order our meal. Since our main course came out and we never got the appetizer, it cost them three drinks too. That's about $30. The waiter wasn't great either. I won't mention his name because I don't do that. But the last waiter we had at this restaurant was also lack luster. We didn't get pineapple or a cherry in our Lava Flow either. What's up with that? I will now only patronize the Tyson's Corner Center TGI Friday's. The difference is like night and day. You can't even really compare them that are so different. It would be like comparing a prison dinning room with Morton's Steakhouse. The difference is so vast. Don't waste your time the farther dive it really worth it.

Have ordered from this place many times through Uber eats and always a good experience until today!! I ordered online to pick it up. The food was ready and the place kind of empty.  Ordered the basket of fries.. well the fries were not fully cooked, hard and cold. When I called to complain, a lady told me: "what is your name? do you want to bring the food to see it and see if you can get another order??""  WHAT?? No. I had to drive for a while to get to the restaurant and what I want is what I ordered, not cold uncooked fries.  I guess I will have to find another place now.. Not what you pay for...

So I arrived her for dinner on 11/28/17 around 6:30.  I waited several minutes at the door for the host to come and seat me.  She ends up taking me over to John' s section and tells me he will be right with me.  I look at the menu and decide what I'd like to eat.  I figured it out with 5 minutes or so.... unfortunately no one  came over to greet me or take my order after 10 minutes.  I end up stopping the hostess to let her know no one has come over.  She then tells me he probably didn't see me and points in his direction. He's directly across from me now serving a table that came after me... I let her know that he saw me because he was across from me, looked at me and continued  chatting with a fellow waitress for several minutes.  She then went and told him I was waiting. She then just says he'll be right over.  At this point it's about 13 minutes in and I just get up and walk to the bar.  I almost left except I was really hungry.  I walked by the hostess again to tell her I'm switching sections  to which she barely even acknowledges me .   Apparently it's not a big deal for a customer to get up and leave for non service.  I ended up sitting at the bar and the waitress greeted me within the first minute and took my order in the next.  She saved it from getting 1 star.  Not that anyone will probably care.  If the management is anything like the employees it won't even matter ..

So I ate here on a early Thursday evening and it wasn't crowded.  So kudos to me!  I wanted to try the unlimited apps because I haven't eaten at Fridays in years and let's just say I'm going to totally keep it that way.  There unlimited app selections are terrible and they've changed. I feel like some items should be regional. I'm not going to lie and say that I've ever eaten fried pickles. But, I'm pretty sure that it's not for the DMV area.  Now, I sat at the bar...which was probably my first mistake. My bartender was decent....I ordered my first app. It was alright. I totally didn't finish it then I wanted to try another one. Obviously, I mean I did order unlimited apps. It took awhile for her to come back from the side are so it took awhile for this 2nd order.  I wanted to order a 3rd round of something different and it was during this time that she merely took my plates. And never asked if I wanted anything else. She proceeded to the back area and I saw her and another employee just talking and chatting it up.  Very odd and weird. It was during this time and I saw another bartender and I asked him to close me out.  Lesson of the story is be attentive especially when you have a fatty like me around. I mean come on you weren't even busy.  I'm never coming back to this establishment again!  The one star is because the food was hot!

Friday's is a great place with servers that are friendly and fast. Food is moderately priced but drinks and desserts will cost you. Our server was very accommodating but the food could have come out faster. Been here many times and always left full and satisfied. The endless appetizers alone are worth the visit at just $10! You can choose from barbecue chicken flatbread , mozzarella sticks, boneless chicken wings  queso dip, and potstickers. I love the flatbread and mozzarella sticks the best but wings weren't bad either. The first order is a normal size and every order after that is half sized, I don't mind this because it prevents food waste and allows you to try different items. If you want a real treat get the mango lemonade it's one of the best drinks you'll ever have and free refills. I've had 3 in one sitting before! Happy hour deals are incredibly cheap and tasty but you can only get them if you sit at the bar, which is crowded at times.

Its OK. We only go here for bdays now because they sing. I ordered the jack Daniels platter as always and it was horrible. The shrimp barely had breading the chicken was over cooked. I sent it right back. Like how could you even bring that out. Yuck.

If I could give negative stars, I would. Unless you're black, you won't get waited on. I showed up to have a burger and beer and to watch the Panthers / Saints game. Waited and waited at the bar and was never acknowledged. A group of 4 came in 10 mins after I did, and the bar back bitch told them that the bartender (bitch) would be with them shortly. She waited on them before me and she still didn't acknowledge me sitting there! This used to be a good spot but not anymore. If you're a white person don't go here! Find another place to eat!

Came in today after 1pm for a late lunch. Not busy at all so why is the hostess taking her time to seat us? We were only 3. She also needs to smile and greet customers cheerfully which didn't happen. Her face was sullen and she moved with no energy to her.  In contrast, the food server was very pleasant. She offered us chips and salsa on the house while we were looking at the menu. Friday's has a not too extensive nor impressive lunch menu which is limited to sliders, chicken salad, and I think it was a quesadilla and maybe half a sandwich. It was a little odd to see how the main entrees did not come with sides. You have to purchase it separately. And the prices didn't seem to reflect a la cart since other similar chain restaurants like chilis, daves bbq, etc offer sides with their meals for the same price at Fridays.  Review of the following:  Combo appetizer-wings (6 pieces) fried mozzarella sticks (4 pieces) potato skins (4 pieces) and potstickers (4 pieces) - skins were a bit dry and chewy. Seemed like they and the sticks had been sitting under a heat lamp. The cheese was not gooey or hot just solid and temp was lukewarm. I ordered the garlic parm wings and was presented with wings that had buffalo sauce. I told the server and she apologized and made it right. Wings came back seasoned with a tasty buttery garlic sauce hot from the fryer. Kids meal - mac and cheese, mandarin oranges, chocolate milk. Good sized portion for a 12-yr-old. The server was attentive and helpful despite the kitchen goof.  They are running an appetizer promo $10 for select menu items. I would go back for the unlimited wings but not much else. Fridays was a big hit back in the day. It was fun to eat there and the food had more variety. This location low energy just like the hostess.

We were looking to go somewhere for a quick family dinner and I suggested Friday's. I used to LOVE their chicken fingers when I was younger, but they've changed the batter and these were not good. Super hard and crispy, unlike the light batter they used to use. I ordered a strawberry lemonade for my daughter and it tasted like water with muddled strawberries added. Everyone else enjoyed their food though, and our server was attentive.

It's been over 10 years since I last ate at a TGI Fridays...and point of fact I probably wouldn't have even considered stepping foot into another TGIF's if not for the Groupon I had.  Hard to believe that at one time, TGIF's was considered a "cool" place to hang out with your friends while getting served by folks wearing red striped shirts and suspenders adorned with wacky buttons or "flair". Thankfully the servers aren't attired in the cheesy get-up anymore, but the food is just as I remembered.  Bland, uninspired, and taste like it was re-heated off a Sysco truck. My dining companion and I ordered a rack of ribs with TGI Friday's famous Jack Daniels sauce and a cheeseburger.  Pretty generic fare and I figured and hard to mess up....WRONG!  The ribs were so dry that pulling the meat from the bone caused it splinter into little pieces like peanut brittle.  But the cheeseburger was the worst part of the meal.   After a few bites, my friend immediately pulled out something dark from the hamburger patty.  It appeared to be a corner of the meat that was over cooked to the point that it was charred.  But that wasn't the worst of it.  Because the end of the patty was so hard and over cooked, it actually chipped her tooth! So lesson learned for me.  Even if Groupon is offering a $15 for $30 deal - just AVOID!   There is a reason TGI Friday's has to resort to gimmicks like unlimited appetizers or Groupons to drum up business - because their food is sub par and the decor is stuck in the 90's.

If a restaurant can't cook a chicken dish correctly than it should really reconsider being a restaurant. They totally butchered my Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta. The dish used to be so great, now it just tastes like pasta with cream and Texas Pete hot sauce poured on top of it, with the addition of rubbery chicken. I told my waitress and she said the chicken comes like that and it's all premade? Okay. Still not acceptable, we went around 6:30 not that busy YET! Seriously though, what happened to the quality of the food here? Will not be returning.

I was here on 6-18-2017.  My server was "Tonja."  She is amazing!!  If you ever go here, request her.  Food was good.  Service was great.  Although she was busy, she was attentive.  She knows what I like without me even having to ask/order.  I highly recommend her.  I will be back.  I'm also a member of your frequent eater program.

Came to this TGIF because my family received a coupon in the mail. Service was mediocre and the food was terrible. The burger was completely dry and over cooked and my spouses meal did not come out correctly. We never received drink refills and the restaurant was nearly empty with a ton of servers.
